ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: BroadScope Crawl and out of memory error
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Are you overriding the default heritrix.properties file?  In particular, this line: org.archive.crawler.datamodel.BigMapFactory.class =

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: BroadScope Crawl and out of memory error
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281
X-Yahoo-Profile: stackarchiveorg

Saurabh Pathak wrote:

>
> Thanks Michael and Gordon for your inputs,
> ...
>
> I looked at my module and dont think that it is creating OOM. To be
> sure I ran the crawler without my custom module and I ran out of
> memory again. I tried running a broadscope crawl on a debian machine
> using the 1.3 snapshot of the CVS head from last week. I also used
> BdBFrontier with 50 threads and allocated 1024M heap. This time
> crawler ran out of memory after downloaing some 90000 documents.

Are you overriding the default heritrix.properties file?  In particular, 
this line: 'org.archive.crawler.datamodel.BigMapFactory.class = 
org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CachedBdbBigMap'?

You might try w/ SUN's JVM -- the 1.5.x JVM -- rather than blackdown to 
see if that gets you further.

Otherwise, please send your order and seeds  -- if thats possible.  I'll 
try running with it over on this end.

Thanks Saurabh.
St.Ack

> > Gordon Mohr (@Internet Archive) wrote:
> >
> > > Once an OutOfMemoryError is hit, a crawl attempts to pause, but will
> > > often be
> > > unable to proceed in any meaningful way, depending on what
> operation was
> > > prevented by the OOM.
> > >
> > > Is the web UI responsive, and can you get a thread report?
> > >
> > > I notice a custom Processor, and HTML parser, in ToeThread #34. It
> would
> > > be interesting to see what URL that thread is working on, and for how
> > > long.
> > > It, or other custom code that's growing a data structure as the crawl
> > > proceeds, could be the cause of the OOM. Our stock crawler components
> > > might
> > > hit an OOM for any broad crawl eventually, but typically not so
> soon with
> > > such a large heap.
> > >
> > > - Gordon @ IA
